channel.title: This land, this heritage, this people
channel.description:
Series featuring readings from letters, diaries, books and narratives, interspersed with songs of the times. Features Prof. Robert Gard, director, Wisconsin Idea Theatre; and Kent Toepfer, guitarist-singer.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: This land, this heritage, this people

item.title: The People of the Ozarks
item.description: The People of the Ozarks. Narrative from the works of folklorist Vance Randolph. Music includes Grandma's Advice, Way Down Yonder in the Paw-Paw Patch, and We're Coming, Arkansas.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Social Studies

item.title: Mike Fink & the Ohio River
item.description: Mike Fink & the Ohio River. Narratives about Fink from a number of sources including Col. Frank Triplett's Conquering the Wilderness, written in 1883; songs include The Lovely Ohio and Shawnee Town.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: River boats--Songs and music.

item.title: Chicago
item.description: Chicago. Music composed between 1858 and 1892 and made available from the Chicago Historical Society archives.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Social Studies

item.title: Mark Twain and the Mississippi
item.description: Mark Twain and the Mississippi. Narratives from writings about the Mississippi from 1693 through Twain's works; also, various songs.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Twain, Mark, 1835-1910

item.title: J. Frank Dobie & Texas
item.description: J. Frank Dobie & Texas. Narrative largely from Dobie's The Flavor of Texas; songs include The Devil in Hell.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Social Studies

item.title: Jack London & Hoboes that Pass in t
item.description: Jack London & Hoboes That Pass in the Night. Songs include You Wonder Why I'm a Hobo, The Gambler, and 900 Miles.
item.dc:creator: University of Wisconsin
item.dc:subject: Social Studies
